title: Power Apps + Dynamics 365 Developer Associate MB-200 & MB-400
subtitle: A master course designed for working professionals like you. Make your career soar with Loyal Bytes.

highlights.heading: Learningmode
highlights.subheading: Group, One-to-One, Corporate Batches, Online Live Classrooms

courseDetail.description: Developers who work with Microsoft Power Apps and Dynamics 365 are responsible for designing, developing, securing, and extending a Dynamics 365 implementation. Candidates implement components of the solution that include application enhancements, custom user experience, system integrations, data conversions, custom process automation, and custom visualizations.

idealFor: Candidates for this exam should have subject matter expertise in planning, implementing, and maintaining Azure networking solutions, including hybrid networking, connectivity, routing, security, and private access to Azure services. Responsibilities for the Azure Network Engineer include recommending, planning, and implementing Azure networking solutions. Professionals in this role manage the solution for performance, resiliency, scale, and security. They deploy networking solutions by using the Azure Portal and other methods, including PowerShell, Azure Command-Line Interface (CLI), and Azure Resource Manager templates (ARM templates). The Azure Network Engineer works with solution architects, cloud administrators, security engineers, application developers, and DevOps engineers to deliver Azure solutions. Candidates for this exam should have expert Azure administration skills, in addition to extensive experience and knowledge of networking, hybrid connections, and network security.
learningObjectives: Create beautiful web flow. Learn how to migrate and host on Microsoft Azure

modules.title: Module 1: PERFORM DISCOVERY, PLANNING, AND ANALYSIS (5-10%)

submodules.heading: CREATE AND VALIDATE DOCUMENTATION
contents: Identify document data for migration and integration
Determine out of the box (oob) functionality
Select artifacts necessary for a proof of concepts (poc) of functional solution designs

submodules.heading: PERFORM CONTINUOUS COLLABORATION WITH CUSTOMERS
contents: Identify artifacts to be recorded in change logs
Select between managed and unmanaged solutions

submodules.heading: CREATE AND CONFIGURE APPS
contents: Configure settings to meet minimal capabilities
Configure out of the box and custom items to meet minimal capabilities specified
Configure apps by using app designer

submodules.heading: CREATE AND CONFIGURE TEMPLATES
contents: Create and configure article and campaign templates

submodules.heading: MODIFY AN EXISTING DATA MODEL
contents: Create new or modify existing entity(s)
Create new or modify existing relationships
Create new or modify existing fields
Create new or modify existing views
Create and configure common data services

submodules.heading: IMPORT AND EXPORT DATA
contents: Import data by using the import data wizard
Choose file types to upload into system
Identify source fields to dynamics 365 fields mapping

submodules.heading: CONFIGURE SECURITY IN OFFICE 365
contents: Add Users to security group administration

submodules.heading: CONFIGURE SECURITY SETTINGS
contents: Create and manage field security profiles

submodules.heading: CONFIGURE APP FOR OUTLOOK
contents: Develop a plan to deploy outlook app to users
Identify minimum application and operating system environments

submodules.heading: INTEGRATE WITH OFFICE 365
contents: Design sharepoint online folder configuration architecture
Create sharepoint sites and document locations
Configure integration with the Office 365 toolset
Validate integrity of data in sharepoint
Integrate data by using Excel data online

submodules.heading: CREATE, CONFIGURE, AND MAINTAIN POWER AUTOMATE FLOWS
contents: Create, validate, and execute power automate logic

modules.title: Module 6: PERFORM SOLUTIONS DEPLOYMENT AND TESTING (25-30%)

submodules.heading: MANAGE ENVIRONMENTS
contents: Determine whether to use managed or unmanaged solution
Determine subcomponents to include in a solution
Create or use a custom publisher

submodules.heading: MANAGE APPS
contents: Manage applications using the Dynamics 365 Admin center

submodules.heading: PERFORM QUALITY ASSURANCE
contents: Create system, performance, unit, and regression testing scripts
Verify network capacity and throughput by using the dynamics 365 diagnostics tool

submodules.heading: VALIDATE REQUIREMENTS AND DESIGN TECHNICAL ARCHITECTURE
contents: Determine whether requirements can be met with out-of-the-box functionality
Determine when to use logic apps versus power automate flows
Determine when to use serverless computing vs. Plug-ins
Determine when to build a virtual entity data source provider vs. When to use connectors

submodules.heading: CONFIGURE SECURITY TO SUPPORT DEVELOPMENT
contents: Create or update security roles and field-level security profiles

modules.title: Module 9: CREATE AND CONFIGURE POWER APPS (10-15%)

submodules.heading: CONFIGURE POWER AUTOMATE
contents: Configure actions to use common data service connectors

submodules.heading: IMPLEMENT PROCESSES
contents: Create and configure business process flows

submodules.heading: APPLY BUSINESS LOGIC USING CLIENT SCRIPTING
contents: Use the web api from client scripting

submodules.heading: CREATE A POWER APPS COMPONENT FRAMEWORK (PCF) COMPONENT
contents: Package, deploy, and consume the component
Use Web API device capabilities and other component framework services

submodules.heading: CREATE A COMMAND BUTTON FUNCTION
contents: Design command button triggers, rules, and actions
Edit the command bar using the ribbon workbench
Modify the form javascript library dependencies

submodules.heading: CREATE A PLUG-IN
contents: Use the global discovery service endpoint
Register custom assemblies by using the plug-in registration tool

submodules.heading: CONFIGURE CUSTOM CONNECTORS FOR POWER APPS AND FLOW
contents: Create a definition for the API

submodules.heading: USE PLATFORM APIS
contents: Interact with data and processes using the Web API
Optimize for performance, concurrency, transactions, and batching
Perform discovery using the Web API
Perform entity metadata operations with the Web API
Use oauth with the platform apis

submodules.heading: PUBLISH AND CONSUME EVENTS
contents: Publish an event by using the API
Publish an event by using the Plug-in Registration Tool
Create an Azure event listener application

submodules.heading: IMPLEMENT DATA SYNCHRONIZATION
contents: Configure and use entity change tracking
Configure the data export service to integrate with azure sql database

onCompletion: The bullets that follow each of the skills measured are intended to illustrate how we are assessing that skill. Related topics may not be covered in the exam.
Most questions cover features that are general availability (GA). The exam may contain questions on Preview features if those features are commonly used.
